Question: Java Writing to a File Test Scores: :I have to make a program that asks the user to enter several scores. Each score needs to be written to the file "scores.txt," but after I enter my 10 scores, the program doesn't do anything, and the scores are not being written to the file. Basically, I'm not sure how to use processFile to show the mean score. The final program should prompt the user for several scores, write the scores to a file, then open that file, calculate the mean, and display it. I have to use an exit condition, and if it is negative, it should assume the user is done entering data.    public class MoreTestScores {    /**     * @param args the command line arguments     */    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {        writeToFile("scores.txt");        processFile("scores.txt");    }    public static void writeToFile (String filename) throws IOException {        BufferedWriter outputWriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("scores.txt"));        System.out.println("Please enter 10 scores.");        System.out.println("You must hit enter after you enter each score.");        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);        int score = 0;        while (score <= 10) {            int val = sc.nextInt();            if (val < 0) break;            outputWriter.write(val);            score++;        }        outputWriter.flush();        outputWriter.close();    }    public static void processFile (String filename) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException {        double sum = 0;        double number;        double average;        double count = 0;        BufferedReader inputReader = new BufferedReader (new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream("scores.txt")));        String line;        while ((line = inputReader.readLine()) != null) {            number = Double.parseDouble(line);            sum += number;            count ++;        }        average = sum/count;        System.out.println(average);        inputReader.close();    }}
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.

Question: Java Writing to a File Test Scores: :I have to make a program that asks the user to enter several scores. Each score needs to be written to the file "scores.txt," but after I enter my 10 scores, the program doesn't do anything, and the scores are not being written to the file. Basically, I'm not sure how to use processFile to show the mean score. The final program should prompt the user for several scores, write the scores to a file, then open that file, calculate the mean, and display it. I have to use an exit condition, and if it is negative, it should assume the user is done entering data.    public class MoreTestScores {    /**     * @param args the command line arguments     */    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {        writeToFile("scores.txt");        processFile("scores.txt");    }    public static void writeToFile (String filename) throws IOException {        BufferedWriter outputWriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("scores.txt"));        System.out.println("Please enter 10 scores.");        System.out.println("You must hit enter after you enter each score.");        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);        int score = 0;        while (score <= 10) {            int val = sc.nextInt();            if (val < 0) break;            outputWriter.write(val);            score++;        }        outputWriter.flush();        outputWriter.close();    }    public static void processFile (String filename) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException {        double sum = 0;        double number;        double average;        double count = 0;        BufferedReader inputReader = new BufferedReader (new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream("scores.txt")));        String line;        while ((line = inputReader.readLine()) != null) {            number = Double.parseDouble(line);            sum += number;            count ++;        }        average = sum/count;        System.out.println(average);        inputReader.close();    }}
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
PrintWriter outputWriter = new PrintWriter("scores.txt");
System.out.println("Please enter 10 scores.");
System.out.println("You must hit enter after you enter each score.");
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
int score = 0;
while (score < 10) {
    int val = sc.nextInt();
    if (val < 0) break;
    outputWriter.write(val + "\n");
    score++;
}
outputWriter.close();
```
<<<explanation>>>: The PrintWriter.write method is used to write to the file. The scores are written to the file with a newline character ("\n") appended after each score. This ensures that each score is written on a new line in the file.

Next, to calculate the mean score, we read the file line by line using a BufferedReader and calculate the sum of all the scores. The number of scores is also counted. Finally, the mean is calculated by dividing the sum by the count.

```java
double sum = 0;
double number;
double average;
double count = 0;
BufferedReader inputReader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("scores.txt"));
String line;
while ((line = inputReader.readLine()) != null) {
    number = Double.parseDouble(line);
    sum += number;
    count++;
}
average = sum / count;
System.out.println("The mean score is: " + average);
inputReader.close();
```
This program will prompt the user to enter scores, write the scores to a file named "scores.txt", calculate the mean of the scores, and display it. The program will stop asking for scores when a negative number is entered.
